descriptionMarkdown:
Mining cell for [rhizome](https://factorioprints.com/view/-NdLYGqTmRBCCk8ujps2).

Miners are supposed to dig out any of four supported ores: coal, stone, copper, iron. Underground belts let other rhizome ore flow through miner cell in all directions.

North and South interfaces are compatible with all other rhizome cells, with the only exception that default cell cannot be to the South due to solar panel incompatibility that cannot be fixed without breaking the design. This incompatibility is notified by incompatible interface: default cell has light to the North, and mining cell has redundant small electrical pole to the South in the same place. Use [Rhizome naked cell](https://factorioprints.com/view/-NdL_F0b_0xJ7zs6M57d) instead of default cell to the South.

Western and Eastern interfaces are intentionally different from most other rhizome cells. This fact is notified by extended pipes. This interface has one ore belt reassigned to another place because it was not possible otherwise to pack so much stuff into so little space. Also, in order for mining cell to be universal, there were introduced two belts in opposite directions. Unlike all other belts, these ones do not go underground on the cell boundary. Whatever miners dig out, comes there first.

Western and Eastern interfaces are compatible only with other mining cells and with injectors. There are [Western injector](https://factorioprints.com/view/-NdLstFQA_Qen0QLiREO) and [Eastern injector](https://factorioprints.com/view/-NdLtygEUzjW1Z-Wneuh). Both injectors enclose opposing mining belts into single mining ring from both ends. Injectors' main function is to detect supported ore type and inject into appropriate side of appropriate belt. So no ore ever gets injected into wrong place.

The algorithm to cover ore patch is as follows:

1. Build mining cells wherever they can mine something (at least one miner is green in Shift mode).
2. Build Western injectors directly to the West of each most Western mining cell.
3. Build Eastern injectors directly to the East of each most Eastern mining cell.
4. Southern edge of most mining cell is now adjacent to mining cell or injector, but some ones remain uncovered, so cover them with naked cell or patch cell.
5. Done.

Example:
```
 wMMMe
wMMMMMe
 nwMMe
   nn
```

The blueprint has productivity mod 3 in every miner. While rhizome-based factory lets produce them faster than previous non-expandable factory, but when used in such high quantities, they are still precious enough to track their usage. When miner goes out of ore, notification icon starts blinking. It means "undeploy me". Delete miner and grab productivity mods out of it. Upon first deployment, chances are high that not all 9 miners will have ore to mine. In order to disable notification, delete corresponding comparator. It will have green signal, but no red signal attached.
title: Rhizome mining cell
